parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "job_name": "g4n1",
    "gpus": 4,
    "gpus_per_node": 4,
    "nodes": 1,
    "ntasks": 4,
    "cpus_per_task": 4,
    "time": "00:15:00",
    "constraint": "a100",
    "reservation": "A100",
    "modules": [
      "dl",
      "deepspeed/0.8.3"
    ],
    "environment_variables": {
      "NCCL_DEBUG": "INFO",
      "NCCL_TREE_THRESHOLD": 0,
      "NCCL_SOCKET_IFNAME": "ib0",
      "NCCL_NET_GDR_LEVEL": 4,
      "NCCL_TOPO_DUMP_FILE": "./nccl_dump.log.${SLURM_JOB_NAME}",
      "MAX_JOBS": "${SLURM_CPUS_PER_TASK}",
      "master_ip": "obtained from hostfile"
    },
    "script_execution": "./run-big-model.sh"
  }
}
```

This script uses SLURM for job management and resource allocation. It requests 4 GPUs, 4 CPUs per task, and runs for 15 minutes. It specifies the "a100" constraint and "A100" reservation. It loads the "dl" and "deepspeed/0.8.3" modules. It sets several environment variables related to NCCL for communication. It then creates a hostfile for the job and obtains the master IP address. Finally, it runs the "run-big-model.sh" script.
